Articles.Content:
I\'ve not released any new craft lately so here is one of my experi-mental rockets instead...

While waiting for docking, new planets, and other cool things that will come in the far distant future ... I thought I might prototype some interplanetary stuff.

What we have here is a prototype orbital refuelling depo. You\'ll have to be careful flying this thing as it is NOT CERTIFIED FOR FLIGHT.

Here are some key features and notes you should be aware of.

> It will lift 20+ tanks of fuel into low Kerbin orbit.

> Sometimes the rocket falls apart on the launch pad. This is a game bug. Restart Kerbal Space Program to fix.

> It\'s NOT certified for orbit. You\'ll have to be careful with the staging else you WILL leave a lot of boosters in orbit.

> The new and improved experimental safety features are guaranteed to get your kerbals killed. DO NOT ATTEMPT TO ABORT MISSION!

> For landing, use parachutes and rocket engine for safe landing. Using only one could end in disaster.

> Pressing \'spacebar\' too much is a great way to get your kerbals killed.

> As this is a prototype, no guarantee, warranty, insurance, or monetary lone will be available for this product.

Use at own risk.

Have a nice day.

8)

How does that thing even lift of the ground? O.O

It\'s huge!

But huge\'s good, I approve! ^w^

How does that thing even lift of the ground? O.O

It\'s huge!

But huge\'s good, I approve! ^w^

The pictures there are just the bit that gets into orbit... I\'ll post a video of it launching soon.

*edit*

I just found a camera mod. Consider the video delayed indefinitely while I play with this...
